對抗中國一帶一路 美國宣布推藍點網絡計畫
06 Nov 2019, 08:57 by https://www.facebook.com/cnanewstaiwan, 中央通訊社
（中央社曼谷5日綜合外電報導）美國商務部長羅斯今天表示，美國將在亞洲增加投資和貿易。美國並推出幫助亞洲「永續發展」的「藍點網絡」計畫，以抗衡中國數千億美元的「一帶一路」基礎設施倡議。
美聯社報導，羅斯（Wilbur Ross）率領高階貿易代表團，與白宮國家安全顧問歐布萊恩（Robert C. O'Brien）出席在泰國首都曼谷近郊舉行的區域峰會，這項會議在昨天閉幕。
猶如歐布萊恩，羅斯試圖消除有關美國總統川普不重視這個地區的疑慮。為了競選連任，川普連續第2年未參加這項峰會，指派他的國安顧問代表出席，使得這種疑慮加深。
羅斯在電話會議告訴記者：「我們無意空出我們的軍事或地緣政治地位。」
他說，許多人誤解川普2017年下令美國退出「跨太平洋夥伴協定」（TPP）的決定，以為這象徵美國對亞太地區興趣缺缺。
羅斯表示：「我們會永遠留在這裡，我們將繼續在這裡投資更多，而且我們將繼續推動更多的雙邊貿易，還有我要花更多時間關注這個地區。」
為了兌現這項承諾，美國官員昨天在曼谷一項千人出席的企業高階會議，宣布川普政府的「藍點網絡」（Blue Dot Network）計畫。這項會議的與會人士包括200名美國企業界高層。
這項計畫的名稱得自已故科學家薩根（Carl Sagan）的著作「暗淡藍點」（Pale Blue Dot），以及無人太空船「旅行家一號」（Voyager 1） 自64億公里外所拍攝的地球照片。
羅斯表示，這項計畫還在初期階段，但將涵蓋承諾推動「永續基礎建設」的國家。歐布萊恩則告訴記者，這項計畫像是評鑑基礎建設投資計畫的「米其林指南」（Michelin Guide），包括維持經濟和社會運轉的道路、港口和能源系統等建設計畫。
美國政府表示，這項計畫是要把諸如澳洲和日本等國家的政府、企業和民間社會結合起來，在「共同標準下」審核認證建設計畫。但目前還不清楚這項計畫會提出什麼投資承諾。（譯者：曹宇帆/核稿：林治平）1081105

Fight against China's Belt and Road, the United States announced the launch of the Blue Point Network Project
06 Nov 2019, 08:57 by https://www.facebook.com/cnanewstaiwan, Central News Agency
(Central News Agency, Bangkok, 5th, comprehensive foreign news report) US Secretary of Commerce Ross said today that the United States will increase investment and trade in Asia. The United States has also launched the "Blue Point Network" program to help Asia's "sustainable development" to counter China's hundreds of billions of dollars in the "Belt and Road" infrastructure initiative.
The Associated Press reported that Wilbur Ross led a high-level trade delegation with White House national security adviser Robert C. O'Brien to attend a regional summit in the outskirts of Bangkok, Thailand, which closed yesterday.
Like O'Brien, Ross tried to eliminate doubts about US President Trump's lack of attention to the region. In order to run for re-election, Trump did not participate in the summit for the second consecutive year, and assigned his representative of the National Security Consultant to make this doubt deepen.
Ross told reporters on the conference call: "We have no intention of vacating our military or geopolitical status."
He said that many people misunderstood Trump's decision in 2017 to order the US to withdraw from the "Trans-Pacific Partnership Agreement" (TPP), thinking that this symbolizes the lack of interest in the Asia-Pacific region.
Ross said: "We will stay here forever, we will continue to invest more here, and we will continue to promote more bilateral trade, and I will spend more time paying attention to this area."
In order to fulfill this commitment, US officials announced a Trump administration's "Blue Dot Network" project at a high-level corporate meeting attended by thousands in Bangkok yesterday. The conference participants included 200 senior executives from the US business community.
The name of the project was taken from the late work of the late scientist Carl Sagan, Pale Blue Dot, and the unmanned spacecraft Voyager 1 from 6.4 billion kilometers away. Earth photo.
Ross said the plan is still in its infancy, but will cover countries that are committed to promoting "sustainable infrastructure." O'Brien told reporters that the model is the Michelin Guide for evaluating infrastructure investment projects, including roads, ports and energy systems that maintain economic and social operations.
The US government said the plan is to combine government, business, and civil society in countries such as Australia and Japan to review and certify design drawings under "common standards." But it is still unclear what investment commitments this plan will make. (Translator: Cao Yufan / Nuclear Release: Lin Zhiping) 1081105
